big_picture: Key policy developments in India today include the Union Minister for Home & Cooperation, Amit Shah, leading a consultative committee discussion on cybercrime. Meanwhile, Rahul Gandhi has called for the scrapping of the Indo-US deal, citing pressure from the US. The Delhi and Bombay High Courts have delivered significant rulings, with the Delhi High Court rejecting pleas for crypto regulation and a CBI probe into Bitbns, while the Bombay High Court reserved a verdict on Rahul Gandhi's plea to quash a defamation case. Additionally, C-DOT and IIT, Delhi have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to collaborate on emerging areas of telecom technology.

story_clusters.summary: The US Supreme Court has scrapped Trump-era tariffs on Indian goods, and as a result, trade deal talks between the US and India have been rescheduled. Indian exports to the US will temporarily face a 10% tariff for 150 days starting from February 24. The decision has created uncertainty in trade relations between the two countries.

story_clusters.summary: The Delhi High Court has ruled that refusing to marry someone after engaging in physical relations due to a mismatch in their horoscopes or "kundali" is an offence. This decision was made in a case where a man was accused of refusing to marry the woman after they had physical relations. The court's ruling applies to such situations where a promise of marriage was made.
